tit.cmt: 名前が間違っています。

sen.j: 能勢 勝右衛門（のせ かつえもん、寛永15年（1638年） - 元禄4年10月2日 (旧暦)（1691年11月21日））は、岡山藩士・知行800石。
sen.e: Katsuuemon NOSE (1638 to November 21, 1691) was a feudal retainer of Okayama Domain with chigyo (a stipend in terms of rice production of the fief) of 800 koku.
Katsuemon NOSE (1638 to November 21, 1691) was a feudal retainer of Okayama Domain with chigyo (a stipend in terms of rice production of the fief) of 800 koku (222.4 cubic meters).
sen.cmt: 800 kokuが説明されていません。名前が間違っています。
sen.e: Katsuemon NOSE (1638 to November 21, 1691) was a feudal retainer of Okayama Domain with chigyo (a stipend in terms of rice production of the fief) of 800 koku (222.4 cubic meters).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 通称は少右衛門のち勝右衛門（但し、高柳利一は「勝右衛門」は役務上の呼称ではないかと指摘している）。
sen.e: His common name was Shouemon, later Katsuuemon, (but Toshikazu TAKAYANAGI is pointing out that 'Katsuuemon' was a vocational naming).
His common name was Shouemon, and later changed to Katsuemon (but Toshikazu TAKAYANAGI is pointing out that 'Katsuemon' was a vocational naming).
sen.cmt: later >>and later changed to Katsuemon名前が間違っています。「（」の「、」を削除しました。
sen.e: His common name was Shouemon, and later changed to Katsuemon (but Toshikazu TAKAYANAGI is pointing out that 'Katsuemon' was a vocational naming).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His imina (real name before death) is unknown.
sen.cmt: 三省道の新明解古語辞典では、「諱」とは「死者の生前の実名」とあり、明治書院の新釈漢和では、「死者の生前の名」とありますので、'real name before death'としました。
sen.e: His imina (personal name) is unknown.
sen.cmt: 「諱」とは「死者の生前の実名」といういみもありますが、「死後にその人を尊んで贈る称号」という意味、また「実名の敬称」という意味もあるので、before deathと断定せず、personal nameとするほうが妥当だと考えます。
sen.e: His imina (personal name) is unknown.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 岡山藩公儀使・能勢少右衛門 の子として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born a son of Shouemon NOSE, a kogishi of Okayama Domain.
He was born as a son of Shouemon NOSE who was a kogishi (shogunate government official) of Okayama Domain.
sen.cmt: He was born a sonではなくHe was born as a son の間違いであると思われます。又、能勢少右衛門の説明で「、」の後a kogishi…と続いていますが、who was aと入れたほうがよいと思われます。公儀使の補足が入っていませんが、公儀使の補足が無く、公儀+使から推察し、shogunate government official としました。
sen.e: He was born as a son of Shouemon NOSE who was a kogishi (shogunate government official) of Okayama Domain.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 寛文12年（1672年）、小姓組組頭を務める。
sen.e: He served as kumigashira (a head of the group) of koshogumi (page corps) in 1672.
He served as kumigashira (a head of the group) of koshogumi (page corps) in 1672.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He served as kumigashira (a head of the group) of koshogumi (page corps) in 1672.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天和 (日本)3年（1683年）閏5月、寺社奉行となる。
sen.e: In May 1683, he became a jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines).
In May 1683, he became a jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In June 1683, he became a jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines).
sen.cmt: May→June（他の箇所がグレゴリオ歴なのでそれに合わせました）

sen.j: 元禄4年8月病となり、日置忠明（家老）・池田武憲（番頭）に病気養生を申し渡された。
sen.e: In August 1901, he became ill, was ordered to take sick leave by Tadaaki HIOKI, (Karo [chief retainer]) and Takenori TAKEDA (Bangashira), and he tried to heal himself in Kyoto, but medicine did not work and he died in Kyoto on October 2.
In August 1901, he became ill and he was ordered to take sick leave by Tadaaki HIOKI, (Karo [chief retainer]) and Takenori TAKEDA (Bangashira)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In August 1901, he became ill and he was ordered to take sick leave by Tadaaki HIOKI, (Karo [chief retainer]) and Takenori TAKEDA (Bangashira)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 京都で療養したものの薬石効無く10月2日京都にて没。
sen.e: He received medical treatment in Kyoto, but medicine did not work and he died in Kyoto on October 2.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処tried to heal himselfでは自分で治療したことになります。Received medical treatmentと修正します。
sen.e: He received medical treatment in Kyoto, but medicine did not work and he died in Kyoto on November 21.
sen.cmt: 最初に日付（グレゴリオ歴）に合わせました。

sen.j: 跡目は、子の能勢権之丞が600石で相続。
sen.e: His heir was his son, Gonnojo NOSE with the inheritance of 600 koku.
His heir was his son, Gonnojo NOSE who inherited 600 koku (166.8 cubic meters).
sen.cmt: 600 kokuの補足がされていません。with the inheritance of からwho inherited 変更します。
sen.e: His heir was his son, Gonnojo NOSE who inherited 600 koku (166.8 cubic meters).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後の能勢本家は、権之丞が元禄13年（1700年）に35歳で若死し、叔父能勢助五郎の子能勢藤十郎が権之丞の養子となり相続したが以降の本家の当主は誰であったのか不明である。
sen.e: After that in NOSE head family, Gonnojo died early at the age of 35 in 1700 and Tojuro NOSE, a son of his uncle, Sukegoro NOSE, became the adopted son who inherited the family, but it is unknown who was the family head of the head family afterward.

After that in NOSE head family, Gonnojo died early at the age of 35 in 1700 and Tojuro NOSE, a son of his uncle Sukegoro NOSE, became the adopted son to inherit the family, but the family head of the head family in later generations are not known.
sen.cmt: uncleの後の「、」を削除しました。became the adopted son who inheritedから、became the adopted son to inherit に変更しました。but it is unknown who was the family head of the head family afterward. から but the family head of the head family in later generations are not known.に変更しました。
sen.e: After that in NOSE head family, Gonnojo died early at the age of 35 in 1700 and Tojuro NOSE, a son of his uncle Sukegoro NOSE, became the adopted son to inherit the family, but the family head of the head family in later generations are not known.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一方で助五郎の家系は150石（幕末は300石）で存続し、助五郎以降は能勢少大夫―能勢頼則―能勢頼忠―能勢勝男と続いた。
sen.e: On the other hand Sukegoro's family lineage continued to exist with 150 koku (300 koku at the end of the Edo period), and after Sukegoro, the family was inherited by Shotaifu NOSE, Yorinori NOSE, Yoritada NOSE, Katsuo NOSE in this order.

On the other hand, Sukegoro's family lineage continued to exist with 150 koku (41.7 cubic meters) (300 koku (83.4 cubic meters) at the end of the Edo period), and after Sukegoro, the family was succeeded in the order of Shotaifu NOSE, Yorinori NOSE, Yoritada NOSE, Katsuo NOSE.
sen.cmt: on the other handの後に「、」を加えました。150koku と300kokuの補足がされていません。Inherited by…in this order >> succeeded in the order of… と変更しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, Sukegoro's family lineage continued to exist with 150 koku (41.7 cubic meters) (300 koku (83.4 cubic meters) at the end of the Edo period), and after Sukegoro, the family was succeeded in the order of Shotaifu NOSE, Yorinori NOSE, Yoritada NOSE, Katsuo NOSE.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
